titleStmt.title: C. B. Anderson et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG4127

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Maysville Ky, Augt 26. 1863.
To his Excellency,
The Governor of Kentucky
Sir:

On the 13th of last June, Edward Fleming, of our City, a very poor man, and so crippled as to disable him (physically) to maintain his family, which is quite large, was fined by our Mayor $20. & costs, for selling a drink of liquor.
Under all the circumstances of the case, we respectfully ask your Excellency to remit the fine; feeling that you would be doing justice to his wife and children.

C. B. Anderson,
Wm C Jenkins
Ryan and Batty.
H. Ryan.
W. F. Wilson
R. G. January
Lewis Dessar
H Bertram
James Shackleford
H. Taylor.
Ross & Newell
Saml W. Owens
Henry L. Newell
J, H, Rains
C G Cady
Wm B. Parker
Charles Phister.
J. Wormald
Wm Davis
Thos. K. Ricketts
N. Cooper
David Clark Jr

Edward Fleming
Pet for Remission of fine $20 -- for retailing
Refused
Tho E Bramlette
Sept 7th 1863
